doc.title: Window.BasicDrawDevice
doc.desc: The Window.BasicDrawDevice class is a DrawDevice used by registering this instance to Window.drawDevice, providing standard drawing functionality.

member.name: BasicDrawDevice
member.desc: Constructs an object of the Window.BasicDrawDevice class. By default, an instance of this class is already registered to Window.drawDevice, so there is no need to register it anew.

member.name: recreate
member.desc: Regenerates the internal device. This is not normally used.

member.name: onDisplayRotate
member.shortdesc: When the screen is rotated (1.1.0 or later)

argitem.name: orientation
argitem.desc: The screen orientation. It will be one of the following values: oriUnknown (failed to get/unknown), oriPortrait (portrait), oriLandscape (landscape)

argitem.name: angle
argitem.desc: The angle. The angle is one of 0, 90, 180, 270, or -1; it is -1 if it could not be retrieved. The angle is the rotation angle from the device's default, so on a portrait device, portrait is 0. On typical devices, landscape is often 0. Portrait becomes 0 on recent 8-inch tablets and similar devices where portrait is the standard orientation.

member.desc: Represents the event function called when the screen is rotated.

member.name: interface
member.desc: Exists for using the DrawDevice object in plugins and similar.
